column5: I was thinking of taking the nephew out for some Bullheads, since the tackle required is very simple and I don't have to keep messing around with lures and casting for him... since he's only 4. Is there anywhere in nearby, or in Whitby, that anyone would suggest that offers good bullhead action?  Thanks in advance for any tips that might be sent my way.
rouge river has plenty of bullhead

although, thats not too close, but you can catch well over 200 there in a day- one time I saw this guy who kept asking me to take the bullhead I was catching, so eventually I started putting them in his bucket (one of those huge white construction ones, it had a cover on it, so I lifted it off and it was legit full of 3-400 bullhead, no water or nothing, it was the funniest thing I've seen there.
Cept I'm telling you mud-pout or bullhead are delicious so who's laughing now.
I don't have to imagine I've done it many times. Five Gallon pails full of 8 inch catfish.
where is this bellwood location you guys speak of?
PM me if you still need a spot.  Got a great spot for fishing and wildlife ( chipmunks will crawl up your leg even if you don't have food for them )
